Lighter amber color than some other Oktoberfest beers.  A clean fresh smell with a crisp malty taste.  I would say more sharp than smooth in flavor.  It finishes with just the right amount of bitterness for me.  Overall a very good beer that I would get again.

A nice amber colored beer.   A rather good size head became just a skim within a few minutes.  Very nice roasted maltiness makes this Marzen pretty smooth and drinkable.  Another good beer from Spaten.
A nice, mouth-filling oktoberfest. Rich orange color, malty aroma, rich taste with just a hint of alcohol
An amber coloured malty tasting beer, with a floral aftertaste.A pleasant mouthfeel although you are aware of the fairly high alcohol content. All round a  decent drink.

Medium amber body.  Head pours big but doesn't last long.  Caramel malty aroma.  Caramel malty taste supplemented with mild hoppiness.  Nothing special about this one, celebrate Oktoberfest with something else.

Smells like a pilsener.  It does taste 
fairly good though.  Tinge of amber color
and flavor to darken it, and it has a hint of 
chocolate and strong caramel flavor.  If 
you are hoping to have this beer in Munich,
sorry.  They serve something else at 
Oktoberfest.  I don't know why the 
ones sold in the US are different but 
they are.  

Re-rate.  The malt balance on these is much better than that of a lot of American counterparts.

Not much on the aroma, but it looks lovely, white head, caramel color, with nice lacing.  Good balanced flavors, and a nice kick.  Hope to someday make it to Munich for Oktoberfest and get it at the Brauhaus.
Fresh off the truck today. Creamy white head. Light amber in color. Malty up front. The beer finishes with a little bit of alcohol and spicy german hops. A good intro beer for a novice.

Dark amber color with a light cream colored head.  Slight malt and floral aroma.  Nutty dry malt flavors.  Dryer finish.  While oktoberfest have fund there way on the shelves year around I always looked forward to these fall offerings.
Had to re-rate this when I found myself rating Sam Adams higher, because this is definitely better than Sam's.  Sort of thin, and one dimensional, however the sweet malt in the middle is enjoyable.
I think I got a skunked version. I see myself liking this beer if it were a little fresher. Poured beautiful and maintained a healthy head.
Average Oktoberfest.  Pretty amber color and a little fruity................
Palate like hard sour-dough pretzels, light on the hops... Ein mehr Stein, Bitte!!

Potent, but with a smooth body that makes the liters go down easily.  Not sweet with a one dimentional caramel flavor like some, but toasty malt dominates.  It is like drinking an artisan bread, the flavor of the best grain.
This is a great Octoberfest. Delicious, malty aroma and flavor. Lightly hopped.  One of my favorite German beers.
You won't be disappointed in the flavor of this beer.  My tastings have been from a bottle, I would love to find this served from a tap...
I'd love to try this from a fresh keg.  Nicely malty with citrusy hops to balance.

Clear, deep orange-copper color, nice white foamy head that leaves a thick lace in the glass.  Has a light flowery and malty caremel aromas, sweet, balanced malts and clean tasting, medium body, a little thin semi-watery mouthfeel, this is a good oktoberfest.
Sweet smell and taste, amber color.  Slightly floral and hoppy.  Nice mouthfeel and finish.
Run of the mill Marzen.  Amber color, weak head, taste of sweet syruppy fruits...blah.
When it comes to Oktoberfest beers, what beats an original?  Nothing because this original is the best, although Paulaner is sneaking up at a close second.

Malty aroma, with a little sour apple? Dark red color, palate is thin, but not watery. Citrusy, with a little hop presence, kind of malty in the finish with sort of a Hawaiian bread taste. Very nice brew.
The best Oktoberfest you can get.Even better at Oktoberfest.................
My favorite Oktoberfest year in and year out. Tremendous balance, with a rich malt character and just enough hops to make it near perfect!! A great beer that is even better on tap!!
I can agree with crisp, I also noted hints of plum in it, overall I simply didn't care for this beer, crisp and clean but missing something and the notes of plum weren't attractive.
Dark amber almost a copper color, rich malty flavor, nice balance between malts & hops, crisp, smooth, but just about average marzen though
Very crisp.  Just the right amount of hops..................................

Sweet, caramel candy aroma.  Robust head and vigorous fine-bubbled carbonation.  Great lacing.  Medium to dark copper/amber color, very clear.  Initial impression is of some form of soda, malt soda??  Nice, caramel amber malt flavors mingling with some lightly bittering tea-ish hops.  Aftertaste is sweet, bready caramel maltiness. Ceamy, effervescent mouthfeel.   Very smooth beer all around.  Recommended.
There's a German restaurant in NE Minneapolis that serves this on tap in the fall.  Smooth and sweet (not cloying) flavor that lends itself to boot drinking.  I prefer it to Paulaner.
Not bad Octoberfest is one of my favorites, I don't find the flavor of this quite as crisp an clean as Samuel Adams Octoberfest or a Beck's.Good though!
A nice beer.  Brought back memories of my Oktoberfest adventures in Munich.
Not at all the same taste as in the huge bier glasses that you get at Oktoberfest. An ok german beer, but not as nosy and flavorful as most.
The guy working in the supermarket grabbed me on my way out to tell me how great this beer was. Sure, I liked it, but I've had a lot better.
The Best oktoberfest I have ever had. Crisp and all around great taste......
Like most german beers, it's bitter aftertaste retracts from it's potential to be a great beer. Paulaner is much better. Until I go to Oktoberfest in Munich I will have to pass.

I think I'm biased by the memories of drinking this at Oktoberfest (and those memories perhaps a bit hazy), but this is a winner in my book. The bottled does not have the clean flavor of the German fresh-from-barrel (18/20), but is a good approximation. Very malty and aromatic, with a slightly sweet but balanced flavor. The only significant downside I'd proffer is its bitter aftertaste, almost absent in a German barrel (can preservatives lend an aftertaste?). Well worth suffering a slightly difficult aftertaste to enjoy the flavor of this real Bavarian marzen.
Smelled a little worty, sweeter taste than I expected. lacks body...........
refreshing malty brew but lacks the body....................................
not as good as Paulaner or Ayinger Octo Fest, but a decent German Octo.  Orange-copper hue, German yeast nose, nice malt flavour, but too thin in body
I can't stand most Oktoberfests.  This is no different.  I think the bitterness isn't quite up my alley.
classic german octo aroma.  amber oclor with no head.  hits of hops in the nows, weak, yeasty and thin lacking creativity.
Sweet, cereal aroma. Same in the taste, almost like raisin bran. Chewy, sweet malts, hearty grain and cereal. Decent palate. My favorite of the style.
Nice aroma and appearance. Has a rounded, beery taste, but little piquance. A smooth brew with a full body, but in taste, comparable to many of the mid-tier macros out there.
Well made flavorful amber but I'll call it and orange beer! The best Octoberfest available on the market. Starts kind of sweet but not overly cloying. Well made bier from Germany!

Fresh and off tap at a busy, well-versed bar. Mid to full-bodied with a foreground dominated by hops and a background of malty sweetness that kicks in at the end of the front. Robust mid of grains and more grains that tapers off to a lingering sweetness. An unbalanced, but balanced finish that should be savored.
If you can get this fresh, your in for a treat.  Perhaps the best import I've had.

Bottle (BB May 2019). Head is initially small, frothy, off-white to light brown, mostly diminishing. Body is clear medium to dark amber. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain, caramel, husks), lightly hoppy (flowers), with light notes of metal and soap. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery/syrupy texture, lively carbonation, slightly metallic. Kind of sloppy and generic overall, but passable.
This is one of my favorite beers of this style..............................
I LOVE this style of beer... this is my favorite Oktoberfest right now, probably because I haven't had Ayinger in awhile.  They are both great.  Green bottle???  Mine wasn't in a green bottle.
Good head. Nice malts and hops. Bit sweet...................................

High marks for appearance and aroma.  Beautiful clear amber with creamy head that stands and then fades.  Flavor is excellent and well balanced.  Moderately complex taste.  Palate was perhaps a little thin, but this could be either a sippin' beer, or a quaffing beer, so again it's well balanced.  In its class, I like the Paulaner slightly more, and the Hacker-Pschorr a little less.
Not my favorite german import, but still good. I want the horses on the label to pull that wagon over my way. Possibly too light for most, but i like it that way. The taste was a little off though

Excellent first look and smell but pretty patchy taken as a whole. There was something barnyard-like in the aftertaste-- goats or hay, my friends and I disagree which. There are certainly worse choices, though.
Small short lasting head, malty aroma/ Sweet malty taste. Sweeter than normal fest IMO. Enjoyable tho. You can go thru a sixer of these no problem.

This beer is really quite beautiful.  It has a nice amber color and produces a nice cream coloured head.    However it is lacking is most other areas.   The mouthfeel seems kind of light. The flavor is kind of lacking, although some hop spiciness is evident in the background.  This Marzen is not a smooth as others that I have tried in that it has a bit of an aftertaste.
Not as sweet as some other Marzens. Easier to get through a few.............
great beer, but aftertaste is a little too much for the type of beer........
Very rich, almost caramel like flavor, finishes very smooth though..........

Overall, a very average brew.  As other raters have stated, the aroma is not appealing, being musty and slightly yeasty.  None of that unpleasantness shows in the flavor, which is dominated by grape, other fruity tones, and a distinct maltiness.  Crisp, subtle hop flavors in the background.  Acceptable amber color with eggshell colored head.  The body is maybe a little on the thin side.  Not the most impressive.  So far, I'll take Dominion Oktoberfest over any other I've tried.

I had a sample of this beer, and decided not to get it based on that. I didn't feel like it had a whole lot of flavor. The amber brown color was pretty and the head was nice. But I didn't feel like there was not much flavor (though to be fair I had had a very flavorful beer just before it so maybe it couldn't compare).
i preferred the sam adams oktoberfest.......................................
I haven't had many Octoberfests but I really liked this one so I may be trying some others.  Very flavorful.
Really nice, smooth, sweet malt flavor with just a hint of hops. Best Oktoberfestbier I've had yet.
Had this at Oktoberfest.  Very nice.  Then again, I was pretty hosed, so it may only be fair.  I dug it, though.  Wish it were around all year!

Much better from the tap, at a faux-Oktoberfest in California.  Amazingly, this gets more complex with each successive pint; at first it was fairly bland, but eventually pumpkin, spice, caramel, toffee and fruit notes were exploding on the palate.  Enjoyable.
Very yummy, malty, sticky, and smooth, and even worth the price of putting up with the sound of 20 fat Germans in lederhosen playing a brass band version of "Mambo no. 5".
Very nice.  A perfect level of maltiness....................................

Its been a while, like 602 days since I had one of these fine beers, Spaten-Franziskaner has been a favorite brewery since my first sampling their beers way back in the late 1970’s.

Transparent amber color on the pour, the head planetary in size, the structure frothy, the color a light tan. Nose is sweet malt; citrus crisp, clean and wholesome, start is loaded with malt, sweet, and the top thin. Finish is mildly acidic, the hops delicate in their spiciness, dry as a bone aftertaste, a clean drinking beer that is a good thirst quencher.
A very good Marzen/ Oktoberfest.  Clean and mushy maltiness, followed by as hint of balancing hops. Full and satisfying on a cool fall evening. Easy to drink a six.

A nice dark amber beer with a thin effvescent head.

rich malty aroma.
a very smooth malty taste, 
only flaw is that it is a little sweeter than needed.
one of the best seasonal brews
Disappointing. Crisp and clean with a nice sweetly toasted maltiness, but it doesn't last. Just thinner and less flavorful than I'd like, especially for the price.
What a super Oktobrfest! The malts are simply layered in the way this style should be. Not too heavy-just right,
Excellent beer for one of the greatest times of the year....................

2001:  This was a 2-Oktoberfest night.  After the disappointment of Otter Creek, I was looking forward to Spaten, a big German brewer I’ve somehow never tried in a decade and a half of serious beer consumption.  Green bottle scared me; nose actually wasn’t skunky (I knew it hadn’t ever been in the light, so didn’t expect it), but wasn’t good either.  Nice color and head, and then a WONDERFUL malty sweet flavor with a knockout end, smooth and silky.  If you can ignore the nose, this one’s a near-classic.  5/4/8/5/15 3.7

September 2005, 12 oz bottle.  Moderately lasting white foamy head covers a medium amber body....a hint of (green bottle) skunk overlays the pleasant earthiness, grassy hops and caramel, and nearly kills it...flavor improves significantly, drier than most but with sublime if light burnt caramel underpinnings, lightly woody/roasty finish..pretty much the same experience as four years ago, I guess in my novice years I had this one pegged right.
Unimpressive flavor, coutered by decent looks, the smell is what really hurts. Smelled like other green bottle beers, not mentioning any names (Heineken!), tasted a bit seltzery.

They say first impressions last forever and, unfortunately, the first whiff I got reeked of skunk.  After I built up enough courage to taste it, I found the flavor to be immune from the impeding spoilage (green bottle, so it counts). Malty and grape aroma and taste. On taste alone, this is decent, but recalling the aroma brings shivers to my spine.
One of the best Oktoberfests on the market.  A tad sweet but very malty.....
Not bad but I'd rather have the Optimator.  THis is kinda like the little brother maybe.
Good fest beer, nice aroma, head, color, and good taste. Taste , i think, varies from year to year. 2000 it was better than 1999.

Well, this is another winner by Spaten.  This is a good beer, similar in my opinion to the Optimator, not quite as dark, and not quite as flavorful. But trust me, this is a damn good beer as well.  People may question why I spend this type of money on beer, but I have to say that beers like this make it worth it!!  I have a hard time putting into words what a beer like this does for me, but this flavor is great.

Great brew - again a yardstick for its style (Spaten has a way with setting the standard.  Aroma - malty and rich.  Appearance - amber/ruby hue with a rich foamy head. Taste - Creamy and warming - malts galore.  Overall - wonderful - even better on tap.  Cheers!
this had a nice slightly hopped aroma, and was a shade or two lighter in coler than I'm used to for this style.  Taste was wonderful, really hit the spot tonight, the first day of October! :)
By far on of the best.  Very nice medium-dark amber color.  Nice matly flavor with a *slight* hint of hops.

How convenient that I sampled this as
it becomes the featured beer of the week.
But of course, its Oktoberfest time.
This beer practically defines the style for me.
Rich malty taste: caramel toffee flavors.
Medium bodied.  Beautiful bright amber color.
What a super Oktobrfest! The malts are simply layered in the way this style should be. Not too heavy-just right,
Excellent beer for one of the greatest times of the year....................
